meanings.definition: The position or status of being a prince.
meanings.sent1: His princeship was evident in the way he carried himself with dignity.
meanings.sent2: The king bestowed the princeship upon his eldest son.
meanings.sent3: The little boy pretended to have princeship over his toy kingdom.
meanings.sent4: In the fairy tale, the princeship was symbolized by the golden crown.
meanings.sent5: The grand ceremony celebrated his princeship and royal lineage.

meanings.definition: The qualities or characteristics of a prince.
meanings.sent1: Courage and nobility are essential to true princeship.
meanings.sent2: The prince's kindness and generosity exemplified his princeship.
meanings.sent3: Even in jest, his friends admired his playful princeship.
meanings.sent4: Her elegance and grace mirrored the essence of princeship.
meanings.sent5: The book described the prince's princeship in great detail.

meanings.definition: The period of time during which a person is a prince.
meanings.sent1: During his princeship, he implemented many reforms in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The princeship of the young prince was marked by peace and prosperity.
meanings.sent3: The short princeship of the prince ended abruptly with his untimely demise.
meanings.sent4: Legends spoke of the legendary princeship that lasted for decades.
meanings.sent5: The princeship of the prince was a time of great change and progress.
